coverage.logic

Class Logic

  • java.lang.Object
    • coverage.logic.Logic

  • public class Logic
extends java.lang.Object
    It is the main class for calculating the logic coverage here

    Wuzhi Xu Date: Jan 23, 2007 TODO:

    • Method Detail

      • getTruthTable

        public TruthTable getTruthTable()
        This method should be deprecated in the future, because it expose the inside data structure to the user Also, two-demension array is too much, replace array with bitset in the future.
        Returns:
        boolean[][] a two dimension array that contains the truth table

      • sizeOfVariables

        public int sizeOfVariables()
        Returns:
        int the number of variables in the expression

      • getVariableInterator

        public java.util.Iterator<VarExpression> getVariableInterator()
        Deprecated. replaced by getVariableArray();
        Returns:
        Iterator the interator that contains all variables

      • getVariableArray

        public VarExpression[] getVariableArray()
        to avoid exposing the inside data structure, return array
        Returns:
        VarExpression[] an array that contains all variables

      • getAllGACC

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<int[]>> getAllGACC()
        If there is three variables, there are three array in the list. The array is int[*][2](* means the length might be 0..n). The order of array in the list is the same as the order of variables in the variables array and truth table.
        Returns:
        List A list of all test pairs for each variables.

      • getAllCACC

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<int[]>> getAllCACC()
        Same as getAllGACC
        Returns:
        List A list of all test pairs for each variables.

      • getAllRACC

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<int[]>> getAllRACC()
        Same as getAllGACC
        Returns:
        List A list of all test pairs for each variables.

      • getAllGICC

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<int[]>> getAllGICC()
        If there is three variables, there are three array in the list. The array is int[*][4](* means the length might be 0..n). The order of array in the list is the same as the order of variables in the variables array and truth table.
        Returns:
        List A list of all test pairs for each variables.

      • getAllRICC

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<int[]>> getAllRICC()

      • createTruthTable

        public TruthTable createTruthTable()
        Returns:
        a TruthTable based on the predicate

      • printTF

        public static java.lang.String printTF(boolean bool)
        Transform true to T and false to F
        Parameters:
        bool - a boolean value
        Returns:
        String "T" or "F"
